channel.title: Will this be enough for server?
channel.description:
[s]RAM: 512 MB Space: 20 gb Bandwidth: unlimited Throughput: 50 Mbps CPU: 0.8 GHz from Intel i7 OS: Linux[/s]
Lol i upgraded to much better server and it works perfect.

item.title: Will this be enough for server?

Space: 20 MB
Bandwidth: unlimited
Throughput: 50 Mbps
CPU: 0.8 GHz from Intel i7
OS: Linux[/quote]

item.title: Will this be enough for server?
item.dc:creator: @Repu Repu
item.description:
@Repu wrote:

[quote=“Stupit, post:12, topic:428759”]We realise that. A i7 runs at like 3.8GHz idling. Seems retarded to only give them .8GHz. The i5 and i7 also have the Turbo Boost technology, which will boost that 3.8GHz to like 4.5GHz.[/quote]They need to make money, hence the execution caps!

item.title: Will this be enough for server?
item.dc:creator: @Repu Repu
item.description:
@Repu wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:9, topic:428759”]Intel Core i7 with only 0.8GHz clock speed? Sounds legit.

Moved to general questions.[/quote]VPS companies cap how much of the CPU you can use,
e.g. If they have a 2 core 4GHz Server they might lend you 1 core and 50% of it’s execution cap so you get 2GHz on your partition of the server.

Read full topic

item.title: Will this be enough for server?
item.dc:creator: @Repu Repu
item.description:
@Repu wrote:

[quote=“skupas, post:1, topic:428759”]RAM: 512 MB
Space: 20 MB
Bandwidth: unlimited
Throughput: 50 Mbps
CPU: 0.8 GHz from Intel i7
OS: Linux[/quote]

Only if you want to host a really stable server with like 10 people maximum online.
I’d get at least 2GHz of processing power, 100Mbps uplink and 2GB of RAM.

p.s. You cannot ask for questions like this here.

Read full topic
item.source: Will this be enough for server?

item.title: Will this be enough for server?
item.dc:creator: @Nouish Nouish

I’d say get one gig of RAM first, then eventually upgrade when you start to run low on free memory.
